```{r Functions, echo=FALSE}
# Function to create lake level snow bulletin plots
snowbullWater <- function(location, parameter, years) {
  # This next line does not work when kniting, but does work when looking at flow_returns internal data. Maybe it will start working once things have been pushed? Should I try pushing? Have added an if statement to deal with this error.
  flood <- WRBfloods:::data$flow_level_flood
  test <-
    WRBplots::hydrometContinuous(
      location = location,
      parameter = parameter,
      startDay = paste0(years, "-10-01"),
      endDay = paste0(as.character(as.numeric(years) + 1), '-09-30'),
      years = years,
      returns = "none"
    )
  if (exists('flood') & !is.null(flood)) {
    test +
      ggplot2::geom_hline(
        yintercept = dplyr::filter(flood, ID == station_id)$Flood_level_asl,
        linetype = "dashed",
        color = "red",
        size = 1
      )
  } else {
    test
  }
  return(test)
}

```
